meanings.definition: The quality of being alive or having life
meanings.sent1: The animateness of the forest was evident in the chirping of birds and rustling of leaves.
meanings.sent2: The zoo was full of animateness, with animals moving and making sounds all around.
meanings.sent3: The animateness of the party was contagious, as everyone danced and laughed together.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with animateness, as if a fire burned within her soul.
meanings.sent5: The animateness of the ocean at sunrise was breathtaking, with waves crashing against the shore.

meanings.definition: The state of being animated or lively
meanings.sent1: The animateness of the cartoon characters brought joy to children watching the show.
meanings.sent2: The animateness of the city streets was invigorating, with people bustling about.
meanings.sent3: The animateness of the painting seemed to come to life, as if the figures could jump off the canvas.
meanings.sent4: His speech was filled with animateness, captivating the audience with his enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The animateness of the music filled the room, making everyone want to dance.
